required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: External Validation of a Septic Arthritis Prognosis Score
clinical_study.official_title: External Validation of the RESAS (REnnes Septic Arthritis Score) Septic Arthritis Prognosis Score in an Acute Arthritis Cohort of Less Than 30 Days

detailed_description.textblock:
Septic arthritis is a diagnostic emergency for acute arthritis because it is accompanied by an excess of mortality of 11% and frequent functional sequelae in about 50% of cases in the year. However, it remains rare with an estimated annual incidence of 1 to 5/100000, and a prevalence of about 10% in front of an acute arthritis table sent to an emergency department.
The diagnosis is based on the bacteriological culture which finds the presence of a microorganism within the joint. However, only 80% of septic arthritis is bacteriologically documented due to low inoculum, the presence of fragile bacteria (Neisseria sp) or especially untimely antibiotherapy prior to joint puncture.
In addition, the bacteriological culture takes an average of 3 days to become positive, which may delay the implementation of appropriate antibiotic therapy.
It is therefore essential that the clinician can rely on other clinical or biological parameters, reliable and fast for better diagnostic orientation.
A first study: SYNOLACTATES showed the interest of the measurement of glucose and synovial lactate for the diagnosis of septic arthritis with very good performances. A RESAS score (REnnes Septic Arthritis Score) was constructed from these results to assess the likelihood of septic arthritis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
primary_outcome.description: Composite score of 4 biological variables of the synovial liquid (macroscopically purulent liquid and/or Synovial White Cells Counts (SWCC) ≥ 75000/mm3, synovial crystal vizualization, synovial lactate dosage, synovial glucose dosage). Each variable is weighted as follows: macroscopically purulent liquid or SWCC ≥ 75000/mm3 (+3 points), UMS (-4 points) or CPP (-2 points) crystal Vizualization, lactate ≥ 11.5 mmol/L (+6 points) or 10-11.4 mmol/L (+4 points) or 8.5-9.9 mmol/L (+2 points), glucose ≤ 1.0 mmol/L (+4 points), 1.1-1.8 mmol/L (+2 points), yielding a total between -4 and 13.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)
secondary_outcome.description: Expressed in multiple qualitative variable: purulent, trouble, clear citrine appearance, hemarthrosis or clear with blood threads

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of crystals in synovial fluid: urate monosodic (UMS) crystal (Yes or No), and calcium pyrophosphate crystal (CPP) (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Number (n) of White cells in synovial fluid. (quantitative variable expressed in n/mm3)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of total lactate, D-lactate et glucose in synovial fluid (quantitative variable expressed in mmol/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of CRP (mg/L) in synovial fluid

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of Procalcitonine (ng/mL) in synovial fluid

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of Calprotectin (ng/mL) in synovial fluid

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (time to collect laboratory results)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of classical clinical marker (quantitative variable) to diagnosis of septic arthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of classical clinical marker (quantitative variable) to diagnosis of septic arthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of classical clinical marker (qualitative variable) to diagnosis of septic arthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)
secondary_outcome.description: Co-morbidity promoting infection (diabetes, cirrhosis, HIV, severe chronic renal failure, rheumatoid arthritis, other inflammatory rheumatic diseases, immunosuppressive treatments such as corticosteroids, conventional synthetic-DMARDs, biological-DMARDs) (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of classical clinical marker (qualitative variable) to diagnosis of septic arthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Parameters that may influence the bacteriological results of synovial fluid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (time to collect clinical parameters)
secondary_outcome.description: NSAIDs, corticosteroids, antibiotics within 15 days of joint puncture (qualitative variable: Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of hospitalization potentially avoided by the early elimination of an arthritis diagnosis and their cost, from the point of view of illness insurance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of hospitalization until 2 months of follow-up

study_pop.textblock: Patients performing joint puncture in routine care as part of a diagnostic assessment of acute arthritis
